poem.author: Peter McCarey
poem.text: A ship was broached, Stern flipped over the beaked prow And beached on a lee shore. No sign of crew; the coastguard Briefed the press and beefed up the night watch. Nothing beeped or flared in rafts Nor bleeped on the radar. There's always a beat: your pulse, The relenting tide, a stubborn Blank where there should be footsteps. All we found on board was some poor Beast that would bleat no more, Bleached and briny. It was Braxy and brawn with vinegar beet for tea.
